entry.title: The Uni­versity of Hel­sinki is 81st in the Na­tional Taiwan Uni­versity rank­ing
entry.content: The University of Helsinki is the third highest-ranking Nordic university, preceded only by the University of Copenhagen and the Karolinska Institutet.

entry.title: Indigenous Studies challenges the Western perspective
entry.content: Since last autumn, the University has offered teaching in Indigenous Studies. The field can benefit students from the arts to legal studies.

entry.title: Three tips for stress management
entry.content: If prolonged, stress may become chronic and change the biological and physiological functions of the body.

entry.title: New application to help study planning
entry.content: Students will have access to a new study planning application during this academic year. The application is currently being tested in two Bachelor’s programmes.

entry.title: Data protection reform to impact daily life at the University
entry.content: The University of Helsinki is updating its data protection practices to comply with the new EU regulation. The new policies will change the way personal information is handled in all units.

entry.title: Stand for election and vote this November
entry.content: The elections for the faculty councils and the University Board will be held 20-22 November. Both are the University’s decision-making organs.

entry.title: Welcome the new chancellor of university of Helsinki, Kaarle Hämeri
entry.content: What is a regular day at the office like as a university chancellor? What are the chancellor’s duties? Watch the video and join the Yammer afterparty with Kaarle Hämeri on Wednesday 4 October.

entry.title: Terkko Health Hub builds bridges between research and business
entry.content: New hub of health and life sciences on the Meilahti Campus provides help with networking and processing ideas.

entry.title: The new Think Corner offers place to meet
entry.content: The completely redesigned Think Corner connects the University community to other institutions in our society, generating opportunities for active dialogue. Think Corner is the University community’s living room, featuring open work stations and spaces that can easily transform into meeting rooms, group work spaces or project facilities.

entry.title: Look before you leap into the new degree programmes
entry.content: Should you transfer to a new degree programme or keep studying under the old degree requirements? This is currently a heated debate among students. Information and help is available to make the right decision.
